09:49 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: hi  
09:49 <@cjdelisle> gmorning  
09:50 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: gdmorning but its aftarnoon here  
09:50 <pulasthi> :)  
09:50 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: btw did u register as a mentor  
09:50 <@cjdelisle> Now that I have a google account I'm trying to figure out what evil thing to do on the app engine first :D  
09:50 <@cjdelisle> A proxy?  
09:50 <@cjdelisle> That won't make anyone mad.  
09:51 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: i made a dictonary a while back using app engine  
09:51 <@cjdelisle> Actually I'm trying to figure out how I can smuggle a compiler into it so I can have it run whatever you post to it.  
09:51 <pulasthi> u can use it gatalk or gmail chat  
09:51 <@cjdelisle> yup  
09:52 <pulasthi> yup is for the mentor question?  
09:52 <@cjdelisle> javac.appspot.com/?code=public class RunMe{public static void main(String[] args){System.out.println("hello world");}}  
09:53 <@cjdelisle> That would be :D  
09:53 <pulasthi> "btw did u register as a mentor"  
09:53 <pulasthi> :)  
09:53 <@cjdelisle> Yea, I asked to be a mentor, noone replied yet, I understand the screening process is tough ;)  
09:53 <pulasthi> ahh  
09:54 <pulasthi> btw have u ever googled "recursion"  
09:54 <@cjdelisle> But yea re account and my name and fingerprint and dna and all that crap.  
09:54 <pulasthi> try it  
09:54 <@cjdelisle> I've seen it.  
09:54 <pulasthi> :)  
09:55 <@cjdelisle> I like the ones where a innocent sounding search and the results are all like major conspiracy theories or something.  
09:55 <pulasthi> lol  
09:55 <@cjdelisle> Best to convince people who don't know the internet to search for it.  
09:56 <@cjdelisle> "hitler's typewriter" what could be wrong with that?  
09:56 <pulasthi> :D  
09:56 <pulasthi> its hitlers thats all it needs  
09:57 <@cjdelisle> oh yea autocomplete is also hilarious  
09:57 <pulasthi> yeah i ve seen some weird stuff  
09:57 <@cjdelisle> "hitler is..." <-- Welcome to the internet.

10:24 <vmassol> nice new testimonial! :)  
10:24 <vmassol> "By far the best wiki apps for the mere mortals. Keep up the good work guys. You have one converted evangelist right here from precursor wiki application."  
10:26 <@cjdelisle> nice  
10:26 <@cjdelisle> now let's get php people to start saying that ;)  
10:26 <vmassol> hey we support the php language in xwiki so maybe that's possible :)  
10:27 <@cjdelisle> We (will) have better storage integration than php so even convincing them to come over to the velocity side might be possible  
10:28 <@cjdelisle> http://groovyconsole.appspot.com/  
10:30 <@cjdelisle> otoh I was just about to write something like that myself  
10:30 <@cjdelisle> now that I have a g00gle account  
10:30 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <vmassol> yep nice  
10:31 <vmassol> something like this on extensions.xwiki.org could be nice for our snippet section  
10:31 <@cjdelisle> D:  
10:32 <@cjdelisle> at least app engine has a sandbox  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> run your groovy scripts here --> find out if that segfault bug in the jvm was patched yet  
10:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw the extension manager doesn't work for me when upgrading  
10:34 <vmassol> I installed a new version of XE  
10:35 <vmassol> then I went to the extension manager admin page  
10:35 <vmassol> it listed several extensions as installed  
10:35 <vmassol> but the pages are not there  
10:35 <vmassol> note: i upgraded my DB during the upgrade  
10:35 <vmassol> (hsqldb)  
10:36 <vmassol> so there's a disynchronization between the actualt state and what's printed  
10:36 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you mean before ?  
10:36 <+tmortagne> i don't see how you can upgrade the db during extion installation  
10:36 <vmassol> easy: you download a new zip  
10:37 <+tmortagne> the db is upgraded when you access xwiki the first time  
10:37 <+tmortagne> you can't install an extension at the exact same same  
10:37 <vmassol> yes that's why I say there' s a bug  
10:37 <vmassol> it didn't work  
10:37 <vmassol> I'll try again  
10:37 <mpaun> has quit  
10:38 <+tmortagne> I don't understand what you expect  
10:38 <+tmortagne> how di you upgraded the xar ?  
10:38 <vmassol> I unzipped the zip  
10:38 <+tmortagne> what the zip have to do with the xar ?  
10:38 <vmassol> I expect that when the ext manager says that extesnions are installed then they are really installed  
10:38 <vmassol> the zip contains the DB  
10:39 <+tmortagne> you replaced the db  you mean ?  
10:39 <vmassol> I download the hsqldb/jetty zip  
10:39 <vmassol> I unzip it  
10:39 <vmassol> I run start\_xwiki.sh  
10:40 <+tmortagne> if it's new you don't have any extension, i think i really don't understand you use case  
10:40 <+tmortagne> to upgrae an extension you have to use extension manager UI right now  
10:41 <+tmortagne> how can i reproduce what you think does not work exactly ?  
10:41 <vmassol> I have some extensions in my extension repo from some previous install  
10:41 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <vmassol> in ~/.xwiki  
10:41 <vmassol> then I do as I said  
10:42 <vmassol> I download the hsqldb/jetty zip  
10:42 <vmassol> 10:39  
10:42 <vmassol> I unzip it  
10:42 <vmassol> 10:39  
10:42 <vmassol> I run http://start\_xwiki.sh/  
10:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok I see now, then yes right now the xar handler expect the xar to ba already installed when xwiki starts  
10:42 <+tmortagne> since does not really have ways to check if it's true or not  
10:42 <+tmortagne> that will be fixed  
10:42 <+tmortagne> when I move the information in the db  
10:42 <+tmortagne> iinstead of the local repo  
10:42 <+tmortagne> instead  
10:43 <vmassol> hmmm  
10:43 <vmassol> I thought we were getting away from the db  
10:43 <vmassol> for binary data  
10:43 <+tmortagne> it's not for binary  
10:43 <vmassol> the files won't be in the db?  
10:43 <+tmortagne> i did not say moving the local repo  
10:43 <vmassol> (just the metadata?)  
10:43 <+tmortagne> just the information telling what is installed where  
10:43 <vmassol> ok  
10:43 <+tmortagne> not even the matadata  
10:44 <+tmortagne> that will allwo dirfferents instance to share the same local repo  
10:44 <+tmortagne> moving a wiki from xem to a standalone installationg keeping the same extensions, etc...  
10:44 <vmassol> ok

11:00 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: You didn't answer a few questions in the repository reorganization thread  
11:01 <vmassol> doing it now sdumitriu  
11:02 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: Good Morning. Can you tell me why the image from attachment differs from the one that is displayed in the page ? I cleared my cache and tried on 2 browsers, but they are still diferent. http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
11:03 <vmassol> done  
11:04 <@sdumitriu> Which one, XEMWikiCreation or createXE?  
11:04 <+sburjan> createXE  
11:05 <vmassol> fyi some useful jenkins scripts: https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Jenkins+Script+Console  
11:05 <@cjdelisle> http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Main/WebHome/createXE.png?width=500  
11:05 <@cjdelisle> http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Main/WebHome/createXE.png  
11:05 <@cjdelisle> not the same  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Cache in the image resize plugin  
11:06 <@cjdelisle> http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Main/WebHome/createXE.png?width=500&flush=cache  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> Bug, report it  
11:06 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: thanks  
11:06 <+sburjan> ok, I will report it now  
11:06 <+sburjan> but it's on a 2.6 might have been fixed  
11:07 <@sdumitriu> mflorea should know  
11:07 <@cjdelisle> If it's not there in the jira search IE: fixed accidently then IMO we should have a report on it anyway.  
11:08 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I'm ready to start the reorg whenever you want  
11:08 <@sdumitriu> I have to go cook some breakfast first  
11:08 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: flushing doesn't work for me :)  
11:08 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ok ping me when you're ready so that we do it together  
11:08 <+sburjan> I mean it's not working  
11:09 <+mflorea> sburjan: what's the issue?  
11:09 <@cjdelisle> me neither, that puts the blame on the image resizer, not the apache front end  
11:10 <+sburjan> mflorea: I have uploaded an image to manager.xwiki.org .. called createXE.png.  When I click on the image from attachments tab, the image is displayed properly, but the image from site is not.  
11:11 <+sburjan> http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Main/WebHome/createXE.png and http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Main/WebHome/createXE.png?width=500 should be the same  
11:11 <@cjdelisle> did you upload the image, then delete then upload again?  
11:11 <+sburjan> yes  
11:11 <+sburjan> I deleted it first, before uploading it again  
11:12 <+sburjan> I guess I'll have to use another name to bypass this FTM  
11:12 <@cjdelisle> If you need a quick fix, ?width=501 ;)  
11:12 <+mflorea> sburjan: why did you delete the attachment first?  
11:12 <+sburjan> mflorea: so I don't keep a bad version  
11:12 <+sburjan> useless usage of database  
11:12 <+mflorea> image plugin caches based on the image version.  
11:13 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: works now :)  
11:13 <+mflorea> so you replaced the version instead of increasing it  
11:13 <+sburjan> mflorea: exactly. the image is still 1.1 version  
11:14 <+mflorea> it's normal that the image plugin give you the old image, because for the image plugin nothing changed  
11:14 <+sburjan> so it's not a bug then :)  
11:14 <+sburjan> true. IMO we should have a flush cache mechanism  
11:14 <@cjdelisle> umm is deleting images and reuploading them supported?  
11:15 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: wdym ? why shouldn't I be allowed to delete and re-upload ?  
11:15 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <@cjdelisle> That's what I'm asking. If it's not supported then I can simplify filesystem attachments :)  
11:17 <+sburjan> i think it must be supported, it's a basic operation. deleting and re-uploading also prevents keeping unneeded versions of the same image in the db.  
11:17 <+sburjan> or in whenever storage container  
11:18 <@cjdelisle> google has a wildcard cert on \*.appspot.com ---> freeee https :D  
11:18 <+sburjan> I didn't knew we cache so much in the backend :)  
11:26 <kd> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
11:27 <@cjdelisle> I've been looking at app engine constraints and even though it is horribly constraining, following those constraints allows for a very good development pattern  
11:29 <@cjdelisle> They don't allow spawning of threads but they allow your process to make http requests or send xmpp messages  
11:29 <@cjdelisle> So it can ostensibly talk to itself, thus you can spawn threads.  
11:30 <@cjdelisle> And if you don't use global static variables then your process can be threadsafe without ever needing to synchronize on anything.  
11:31 <@cjdelisle> if only I could catch the XWQL bug :/  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: You can start by updating the poms of all extensions  
11:34 <vmassol> but they're no longer extensions in this scheme  
11:34 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: You can start by updating the poms of all "things"  
11:34 <@sdumitriu> :)  
11:34 <vmassol> they need to be moved first  
11:34 <vmassol> IMo we move everything in platform/modules (if the name is ok for you)  
11:34 <vmassol> then we can work on the poms  
11:35 <@sdumitriu> K  
11:37 <@sdumitriu> Ah, vmassol, you didn't answer about xwiki-skin-colibri vs. xwiki-colibri  
11:37 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I did  
11:37 <vmassol> kind of  
11:37 <vmassol> with the naming proposal for directories  
11:38 <vmassol> but yes even with that we still need a name  
11:38 <vmassol> my problem with xwiki-platform-colibri is that we don't know what colibri is but I agree that having  
11:38 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-skin-colibri would mean a skins directory....  
11:38 <vmassol> and since we said we don't have one now  
11:38 <vmassol> I'm ok with xwiki-platform-colibri for the moment  
11:39 <vmassol> this means an artifact id of xwiki-platform-colibri too btw  
11:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdyt?  
11:40 <arkub> has quit  
11:42 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <+tmortagne> vmassol: makes it a bit hard to know it's a skin but lets say I'm +0  
11:43 <@sdumitriu> Then all others should be updated to include their type in the name  
11:43 <@sdumitriu> Either all or none  
11:44 <+tmortagne> skins are a bit special, their names is not very descriptive, it does not indicate a feature  
11:44 <vmassol> yes except they don't all have types  
11:45 <vmassol> tmortagne is right, usually names are based on features not code names  
11:46 <vmassol> could be xwiki-platform-colibri-skin :-P  
11:46 <vmassol> the suffix being not the type but a qualifier.....  
11:46 <vmassol> I'm +0 whatever you guys want  
11:48 <+tmortagne> I like colibri-skin idea actually but same for me i'm +0, after all we can sayd that project names that don't mean anything have a good chance to be skins ;)  
11:49 <+tmortagne> and they do have a common point: birds names  
11:49 <+tmortagne> the only thing is that they are not grouped when sorted alphabetically  
11:53 <@cjdelisle> http://pastebin.com/LTeYQRzV started with this... moving up in the world :)  
12:15 <arkub> has quit  
12:16 <kd> has quit  
12:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: are you creating the new xwiki-patform-modules repo?  
12:18 <vmassol> if you start creating it, i can start helping out by creating the root pom for it and help move stuff in it  
12:19 <vmassol> I could also work on the jira side for now if you prefer  
12:23 <sbose78> has joined #xwiki  
12:24 <sbose78> Hello  
12:26 <sbose78> Need more briefing about the exact work in the "query layer for Appengine" project  
12:29 <@cjdelisle> Not sure there's really a briefing to be heard but if you have a specific question I can try to answer it.  
12:33 <sbose78> Okay.  
12:34 <sbose78> What do you exactly mean by a query layer in the project's context?  
12:34 <sbose78> something that makes a conversion into QUERY TYPE 1 to QUERY TYPE 2, right?  
12:35 <@cjdelisle> Yes something like that.  
12:36 <Avipar> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <sbose78> Could you tell me, what's the challenge in the project? I mean, which are the areas that could throw up issues.?  
12:41 <@cjdelisle> http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/devs/2011-April/022464.html  
12:41 <@cjdelisle> Read that thread and all the replies  
12:42 <sbose78> Okay.  
12:42 <@cjdelisle> The biggest issue I see is that the XWQL standard is lax (undefined) and so perfect compatability is going to be impossible.  
12:44 <sbose78> RIght, which means, getting a query layer for Datastore for the somewhat lax XWQL is the challenge  
12:45 <@cjdelisle> That is one challange  
12:46 <sbose78> Okay.  
12:48 <@cjdelisle> Another challange is going to be proving that xwiki will have reasonable performance on a different data store.  
12:50 <sbose78> Okay, wonderful .  
12:52 <@cjdelisle> :)  
12:53 <mflorea> has quit  
12:58 <sbose78> With regards to the first challenge we discussed, don't you think using queries in the String syntax causes problems  
12:58 <sbose78> ?  
12:58 <sbose78> http://code.google.com/appengine/docs/java/datastore/jdo/queries.html  
12:59 <sbose78> Using setFilter( ) , setOrdering() makes things slightly easier I guess  
13:00 <@cjdelisle> Yea, string queries are bad but that is what everything existing now is written for.  
13:00 <sbose78> ^ ^ I meant using the non-String syntax ( and developing libraries to handle it should help)  
13:01 <sbose78> :)  
13:11 <sbose78> So, basically, the query layer would standardise the query language at the Google Datastore side.  
13:12 <@cjdelisle> naw, it would take one non-standardized query language and convert it into another non-standardized query language :)  
13:13 <sbose78> :D  :D thats true actually... if the "input" is not standardised .. how can the "output" be !!?  
13:14 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: thanks for your feedback ill do sme reaserch on the area u pointed :) add the points asiri gave me and redo the proposal  
13:14 <pulasthi> :)  
13:14 <pulasthi> i also havent looked at anything else that DN :) .  
13:14 <@cjdelisle> take with big grains of salt, I've lead people astray before.  
13:15 <sbose78> Sometimes going astray helps discovering lesser known lands !  
13:19 <mihaipaun> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <mpaun> has quit  
13:21 <sbose78> cjedeisle:  Thanks for your help. I'll get in touch with you later.  
13:23 <@cjdelisle> sure thing. I'll probably be in bed later  
13:25 <@cjdelisle> oh another thing ( pulasthi ) about GAE that made me hesitant is the format lockin.  
13:25 <@cjdelisle> once you write it for GAE you can't leave...  
13:26 <@cjdelisle> And it's a damn shame because the platform has so much potential.  
13:26 <abusenius> has quit  
13:27 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: ahh maybe they thought one will never need anything else  
13:27 <pulasthi> :)  
13:28 <pulasthi> google kind of thinks in that way  
13:28 <pulasthi> ;)  
13:28 <@cjdelisle> yea. They should know that people (devs especially) get nervice at the suggestion of lockin.  
13:29 <pulasthi> :)  
13:30 <pulasthi> there too powerful now things like those dnt seem to get into there head  
13:30 <pulasthi> alse why would they introduce the Key feild  
13:30 <pulasthi> its good but can only be used in GAE  
13:31 <@cjdelisle> I think it's used internally so if they want to add stuff for themselves they will.  
13:31 <pulasthi> hmm  
13:32 <@cjdelisle> Also Key is not mandatory, it maps to [column, row, timestamp]  
13:32 <@cjdelisle> IIRC  
13:32 <@cjdelisle> so just by not using it you can avoid it's problems.  
13:33 <pulasthi> ya thats true but it would be tempting to anyone that has no initial plan of moving away from GAE  
13:33 <pulasthi> to use it  
13:34 <@cjdelisle> todo is understand the (API) difference between HBase and BigTable  
13:35 <@cjdelisle> Also figure out if I can store stuff in BigTable encrypted and never give big G the key ;)  
13:35 <pulasthi> :D  
13:36 <@cjdelisle> Did you see the pastebin I linked a couple hours back?  
13:36 <pulasthi> ya  
13:36 <@cjdelisle> I have a script to make those  
13:36 <pulasthi> so whats the encrption format  
13:37 <@cjdelisle> Anyone using linux can paste it into their terminal and (If I still had the passwd) they could enter it and it would self decrypt  
13:38 <@cjdelisle> see at the bottom? ' | openssl enc -d -base64 | openssl enc -d -cast5  
13:38 <@cjdelisle> that's the decrypt command
